As an AI language model, I don't have personal experience of physical health but here are a few tips that can help balance academic success and physical health during college and prevent burnout:

1. Create a schedule for studying and exercise: Establish a routine that includes time for studying, exercise, and other hobbies. Stick to this schedule as much as possible to stay on track.

2. Take breaks: Don't study or work out intensely for hours without taking a break. Take short breaks to stretch, meditate or take a walk, and relax. 

3. Get enough sleep: Aim to get 7-8 hours of sleep every night to help your mind and body recharge. Avoid pulling all-nighters to catch up on studying as this often backfires.

4. Eat a balanced diet: Incorporate healthy foods to nourish your body and brain. Avoid junk food and sugary snacks as they often lead to a crash in energy levels. 

5. Stay hydrated: Make sure to drink plenty of water to keep your body hydrated and focused.

6. Join a sports team or gym class: Participating in group fitness or sports can help you stay motivated and make exercise more enjoyable.

7. Practice stress-reducing techniques: Consider practicing yoga, meditation, or deep breathing to help reduce stress and anxiety.

8. Don't hesitate to seek help: If you're struggling with academic or personal stress, don't hesitate to reach out to your college counselor or advisors. 

These tips can help prevent burnout and maintain a balance between academic success and physical health during college. Remember, it's essential to take care of your physical and mental well-being to achieve your goals and enjoy your college experience.
